questions.questionText: Five people A, B, C, D, E live on floors 1-5 (1 being lowest). A lives above C but below E. D lives on floor 2. Who lives on floor 4?
questions.explanation: D=2. A is above C but below E. Possible: C=1, A=3, E=4 or 5. Since B must fit, E=4, B=5 works. Or C=1, A=3, B=4, E=5. Need more info but E on 4 is valid possibility.

questions.questionText: Three friends have different ages. A is older than B but younger than C. Who is the youngest?
questions.explanation: A > B and C > A, so order is C > A > B. B is youngest.

questions.questionText: Four boxes Red, Blue, Green, Yellow are stacked. Red is above Blue. Green is not at bottom. Yellow is between Red and Green. What is the order from top?
questions.explanation: Red above Blue. Yellow between Red and Green. Green not at bottom. Order: Red-Yellow-Green-Blue

questions.questionText: Three people born in different months: P in March, Q before P, R after P. In which month was R born?
questions.explanation: R is after March, so April onwards, but exact month cannot be determined

questions.questionText: Five people sit in a row. A and B sit together. C sits at one end. D sits between A and E. Who sits at the other end?
questions.explanation: Multiple arrangements possible. Need more specific clues to determine exact positions.
